results.title: Sea eagles
results.creator_credit: David E. Barrow, Peter Johnson and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A recruiting film for the Royal Australian Navy, showing life in Australia’s Fleet Air Arm. We see how living on an aircraft carrier is exciting and full of non-stop action. We also see how Australia’s Navy aviators fly helicopters for rescue and recovery, as well as attack, and the striking force of the fixed wing Skyhawk jets and the two-engined Tracker aircraft as they come and go from the deck of their seabound base.

results.title: Sea creatures
results.brief_description: An underwater look at the inhabitants of the Red Sea. These creatures appear to be from another world yet they are a very real part of the Sea’s ecosystem. Imaginative music and sound effects heighten the beautiful underwater photography. This film is a comment upon the fragile web of life. Film without narration.

results.title: Sculptured seal
results.brief_description: Follows the work of Tom Bass on the 70-foot copper relief mural at the entrance of the National Library, Canberra, a symbolic complex embodying traditional images of learning and cultural heritage. The sculptor explains his approach to the project as its development from sketches and models through fabrication and placing of the completed work is shown.

results.title: Sculpture of the Parthenon
results.creator_credit: Howard Tracy and Hugh Baddeley Productions
results.brief_description: Provides a comprehensive coverage of the sculpture of the Parthenon. In addition to the remains in Athens, the film covers the full scale replica of the Parthenon at Nashville, Tennessee; the model and exhibits in the Royal Ontario Museum of Toronto, Canada. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Scrooge McDuck and money (K)
results.brief_description: The history and value of money is retold in an amusing and entertaining manner to three young ducks by their wealthy uncle Scrooge McDuck. The wise old man also offers advice on budgeting and taxes.

results.title: Screening Nuclear Hazard
results.brief_description: An attempt to show how a complicated and sensitive issue is handled by television. The example used is a BBC Horizon program produced in 1979 and entitled “Elements of Risk”. The film examines the conception, shooting and editing of the program. Begins with a brief discussion of how the same issue is handled by BBC News

results.title: Screening Middlemarch: [19th. century] novel to 90's TV
results.brief_description: Takes the student and the teacher behind the scenes to offer fascinating insights into the complex task of bringing a great 19th Century novel to the television screen. It uses authentic materials from different aspects of the TV and radio production process. It gives opportunities to compare George Eliot’s original text with the radio adaptation, the TV production and the screenwriter’s version, by using excerpts from the actual dramatisation. Allows both teachers and students the opportunity to re-edit some of the shots taken by the production team, and to compare their versions with the broadcast version. It examines the roles of sound effects and music in relation to narrative and realism. This programme will not only teach the process of turning a book into a television serial, but by examining such concepts as narrative, realism, character, gender, class and the use of the authorial voice, will also help students with the study of the novel generally. The kit contains one 90 minute videocassette, one 60 minute audiocassette and one comprehensive activity book.
